dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, there's a lot of chatter this week, uh, about potential taxpayer-funded aid for Boeing. And, like, immediately, you know there's gonna be criticism, right? Especially after the year they've had.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, there's a lot of chatter this week, uh, about potential taxpayer-funded aid for Boeing. And, like, immediately, you know there's gonna be criticism, right? Especially after the year they've had.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Any taxpayer-funded aid for Boeing is bound to raise criticism after a year of harsh scrutiny of its failures that led to two fatal crashes of its flagship airliner, the 737 MAX.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely. I mean, the shadow of the 737 MAX crashes is still, like, really looming large. People aren't gonna forget that when we're talking about bailouts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. I mean, the shadow of the seven hundred thirty seven meters A X crashes is still, like, really looming large. People aren't gonna forget that when we're talking about bailouts.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Any taxpayer-funded aid for Boeing is bound to raise criticism after a year of harsh scrutiny of its failures that led to two fatal crashes of its flagship airliner, the 737 MAX.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. Boeing's, um, trying to frame it as support for the broader U.S. aerospace industry, saying it'll flow through to suppliers, not just them directly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. Boeing's, um, trying to frame it as support for the broader U S aerospace industry, saying it'll flow through to suppliers, not just them directly.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Boeing stressed in a statement that financial support for the company would flow through to its suppliers and support the broader health of the U.S. aerospace industry.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but they haven't actually said how much of that rumored $60 billion they *think* they need. And, like, let's be honest, they were already in a rough spot.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but they haven't actually said how much of that rumored sixty billion dollars they think they need. And, like, let's be honest, they were already in a rough spot.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The statement didnt specify how much of the $60 billion the company believes it needs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. The MAX grounding, you know, they've burned billions producing 400 planes they can't even deliver. And now, this global pandemic...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. The M A X grounding, you know, they've burned billions producing four hundred planes they can't even deliver. And now, this global pandemic...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Boeing burned through billions in cash as it produced roughly 400 models of the plane that it has been unable to deliver to customers due to the planes grounding by global regulators.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Which just compounds it! Airlines are struggling, so they're gonna delay deliveries, and then, like, aftermarket sales for parts are gonna plummet too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which just compounds it! Airlines are struggling, so they're gonna delay deliveries, and then, like, aftermarket sales for parts are gonna plummet too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...many carriers will delay delivery of planes, slowing Boeings recovery once the 737 MAX returns to service. Parts manufacturers also face the prospect of a sharp slowdown in aftermarket sales with airlines parking planes and deferring maintenance.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Even President Trump has weighed in, saying we have to "protect Boeing" because, well, the airlines aren't doing well.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Even President Trump has weighed in, saying we have to protect Boeing because, well, the airlines aren't doing well.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier in the day, President Trump said at a press conference that support would be forthcoming. I think we have to protect Boeing, he said. Obviously when the airlines aren't doing well then Boeing is not going to be doing well. So we'll be helping Boeing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And speaking of airlines, they're asking for their own bailout, what, like $50 billion for passenger carriers alone? It's a huge ask.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And speaking of airlines, they're asking for their own bailout, what, like fifty billion dollars for passenger carriers alone? It's a huge ask.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: U.S. airlines on Monday called for a bailout of their own, to the tune of $50 billion in grants and loans for passenger carriers and $8 billion for cargo carriers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It is. And Boeing's facing a real liquidity crisis. Their stock's plummeted, they just drew down a massive credit line... S&P downgraded them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It is. And Boeing's facing a real liquidity crisis. Their stock's plummeted, they just drew down a massive credit line... S and P downgraded them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Concern has been rising over the past week that Boeing may face a liquidity crisis, with its stock plummeting 44% over that span to close Tuesday at $124.14, its lowest point since 2016. The Chicago-based company disclosed in an SEC filing after the close of trading that it had fully drawn $13.8 billion from a line of credit it had arranged just last month. On Monday, Standard & Poors downgraded Boeing debt two notches to BBB from A-...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, an analyst even warned that more loans could, like, encumber them with so much debt they can't effectively compete in the future.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, an analyst even warned that more loans could, like, encumber them with so much debt they can't effectively compete in the future.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This could leave Boeing so encumbered with debt that it is unable to effectively compete, he wrote.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Which, um, brings up the sticky point for critics: all those share buybacks over the past decade. Enriching shareholders, now asking for public money.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, um, brings up the sticky point for critics: all those share buybacks over the past decade. Enriching shareholders, now asking for public money.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Critics of the prospect of so much taxpayer money going to Boeing and the airlines have focused on the billions of dollars worth of share buybacks that they have made over the past decade, enriching executives and their shareholders.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's the part that really, I think, gets people. But then, you look at the sheer scale of the industry â€“ 2.5 million workers in 17,000 firms.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's the part that really, I think, gets people. But then, you look at the sheer scale of the industry - two point five million workers in seventeen thousand firms.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Boeing stands at the apex of a pyramid of 17,000 aerospace firms that employ 2.5 million workers while U.S. airlines directly employ 75o,000.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's so critical to the economy that, like, a bailout almost feels like a foregone conclusion, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's so critical to the economy that, like, a bailout almost feels like a foregone conclusion, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The millions of jobs the companies support and their critical role in the economy likely make a bailout a foregone conclusion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I think so. But lawmakers and labor groups are, um, really pushing for conditions this time. Like, no dividends, no executive bonuses.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I think so. But lawmakers and labor groups are, um, really pushing for conditions this time. Like, no dividends, no executive bonuses.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, lawmakers and labor groups will seek to put conditions on the assistance. Suspension of Boeings continued dividends to its shareholders could be one.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Sara Nelson, from the Flight Attendants union, she's been very vocal about that. No easy ride like the banks got in 2008.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Sara Nelson, from the Flight Attendants union, she's been very vocal about that. No easy ride like the banks got in two thousand eight.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Sara Nelson, the president of the Association of Flight Attendants-CWA, vowed Monday that airlines wouldnt make out as easy as the banks did in 2008.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. The pandemic isn't their fault, but that doesn't mean it should enrich shareholders. It needs to protect workers and keep planes flying, not just, like, prop up stock prices.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. The pandemic isn't their fault, but that doesn't mean it should enrich shareholders. It needs to protect workers and keep planes flying, not just, like, prop up stock prices.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The airline industry didnt cause the pandemic and money should come with significant conditions to help workers and keep planes flying, not enrich shareholders or pad executive bonuses, she said on Twitter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's a tough line to walk, but conditions are absolutely key here, I think.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a tough line to walk, but conditions are absolutely key here, I think.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Agreed. We'll be watching this one closely.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Agreed. We'll be watching this one closely.
